lexUnit.name: perceive.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: become aware or conscious of.

sentence.text: The public perceived enormous Conservative stress on defence in the Pre-Campaign Wave and again in the latter half of the campaign , but much less in the first half of the campaign .
Thus engineers should learn about how the public perceives risk and makes risk decisions .
It will depend on how clearly the teacher perceives the purpose of making the recording .
While most participants perceived the problem they differed somewhat over the matter of its resolution .
Sadly , however , 95% of respondents thought that their clients had not perceived any benefits , with one or two adding the comment ` except higher fees " .
Those who had been previously addicted to opioids could perceive no changes whatsoever .
The Collector had already perceived that all was not well with the Doctor .
Whether it is true or not that good teachers are born , not made , they accurately perceived that bad teachers , at least in many cases , are made , not born .
Finally , how do DGMs perceive the benefits and losses so far ?
Apart from the worry over The Family Reunion , I perceived that lie was under considerable strain .
They perceive that they have no influence over their own lives , or over the quality of their own lives .
Mr Mallory perceived that his ice was warm and half melted inside its chocolate coating , and that it was dripping on to his new suit .
Hence , Congress immediately perceived the practicality of creating a physical link between them , and approved the necessary funds .
This may , say Buzzell and Chussil , be because businesses are using portfolio analysis too simplistically and not perceiving the remaining potential of ` cash cows " and ` dogs " .
Tawney perceived the same problem throughout his career of commentary on the education system .
If parents perceive that the quality of education offered by a school is inadequate , they will move their children to another school by exercising choice through the mechanism of open enrolments .
From their lowly status they were still able to perceive who was who in the Rowdies hierarchy and which subunits were worth making a try for .
It is perceived that researchers wish to dot the i 's and cross the t's .
